data.name: Hatha Yoga
data.description: Hatha yoga is a traditional form that emphasizes physical postures, breath control, and meditation.
suitable_for: Beginners looking to learn the fundamentals.
Those seeking a gentler, slower-paced practice.

data.name: Downward-Facing Dog
data.description: An inversion pose that forms an inverted V-shape, stretching the entire back of the body.
benefits: Strengthens the arms, shoulders, and legs.
Stretches the hamstrings, calves, and spine.
Energizes the body and calms the mind.

physical: Maintains a balanced metabolism and promotes cardiovascular health.
mental: Improves focus, concentration, and mental clarity.

beginners: Start with beginner-friendly classes to learn proper alignment.
Don't push beyond your comfort zone; listen to your body.
Consistency is more important than intensity.
practice: Focus on your breath throughout your practice.
Use modifications when needed to suit your body.
Practice with intention, setting a purpose for each session.
props: Yoga blocks can help bring the floor closer in standing forward folds.
Straps are useful for extending your reach in seated poses.
Blankets provide support for seated meditation and joint comfort.
